factions.name: The Caravan Collective
factions.description: A vast network of traders and scavengers who roam the wasteland, connecting isolated settlements through commerce. They prioritize profit and survival over all else, maintaining neutrality to ensure safe passage. Their caravans are heavily guarded and recognizable by their patchwork banners.
factions.ideology: Profit through peace. They believe trade is the key to rebuilding civilization and will go to great lengths to protect their business interests.
factions.territory: Nomadic, but they have established trade hubs in abandoned shopping malls and highway rest stops across the region.
perks: Extensive trade network with reliable contacts
Well-armed caravan guards
Knowledge of safe routes and hidden caches
weaknesses: Over-reliance on trade routes makes them predictable
Internal disputes over profit can lead to infighting

factions.name: The Iron Vanguard
factions.description: A disciplined, militaristic faction composed of former soldiers and survivalists who believe in strict hierarchy and order. They operate from a fortified subway station, using guerrilla tactics to maintain control and eliminate threats. Their motto: 'Strength through discipline, survival through unity.'
factions.ideology: Order and survival above all else. They see chaos as the true enemy and believe only a structured, militarized society can withstand the apocalypse.
factions.territory: A heavily fortified subway station and adjacent tunnels, repurposed into a defensible stronghold with barricades and traps.
perks: Expert ambush tactics
Highly trained in close-quarters combat
Efficient scavenging operations
weaknesses: Limited numbers due to strict recruitment
Over-reliance on centralized leadership

factions.name: The Fog Dwellers
factions.description: A secretive group of survivors who have adapted to life in the fog-choked subway tunnels. They use the bioluminescent fungal growths to navigate and have developed an almost symbiotic relationship with the underground environment.
factions.ideology: Survival through stealth and adaptation. They believe the fog and fungi are nature's way of protecting them from both zombies and hostile survivors.
factions.territory: The labyrinthine subway tunnels beneath Central Station, particularly the abandoned maintenance shafts and service tunnels.
resources: Bioluminescent fungi for light and navigation
Subway maintenance tools repurposed as weapons
perks: Exceptional night vision and low-light combat skills
Can navigate tunnels silently and efficiently
Knowledge of fungal growth patterns to predict zombie movements
weaknesses: Vulnerable to bright lights and loud noises that disrupt their adapted senses
Limited surface combat experience

factions.name: The Fog Reapers
factions.description: A ruthless bandit faction that thrives in the fog-choked tunnels beneath Central Station. They use the unnatural mist as both camouflage and psychological warfare, striking from nowhere and vanishing without a trace. Survivors whisper that they've made some dark pact with whatever lurks in the depths.
factions.ideology: Might makes right - they take what they want from the weak and believe the fog protects them. Some members genuinely worship the creeping mist as a living entity.
factions.territory: The maintenance tunnels and abandoned subway lines radiating from Central Station
resources: A hidden armory in a signal control room
perks: Can see clearly in fog while others are blinded
Ambush tactics grant first-strike advantage
Tunnel knowledge allows rapid disappearance
weaknesses: Reliant on confined spaces - weak in open areas
Leadership disputes frequently turn violent

factions.name: The Luminous Choir
factions.description: A fanatical cult that worships the bioluminescent fungal growths as divine manifestations. They believe the fungal infection is a sacred transformation, guiding humanity to a higher state of being. Their followers are known for their eerie chants and glowing fungal tattoos.
factions.ideology: The Luminous Choir seeks to spread the 'gift' of the fungal infection, viewing it as a divine blessing. They believe the apocalypse is a necessary purification, and those who resist are heretics to be converted or eradicated.
factions.territory: They dominate the underground tunnels and subway systems, where the fungal growths thrive. Their main stronghold is the abandoned Grand Central Station, now a glowing cathedral of fungal tendrils.
perks: Fungal Immunity: Members are resistant to fungal infections
Bioluminescent Camouflage: Can blend into fungal-lit environments
Fanatic Zeal: Fearless in battle, believing death brings divine union
weaknesses: Light Sensitivity: Vulnerable to bright artificial light
Dependent on Fungal Growths: Lose power in sterile environments

factions.name: The Sporebound
factions.description: A small commune of survivors who believe the fungal growths are a form of higher intelligence. They have learned to coexist with the infection, using it to their advantage. Their base is hidden deep within the tunnel network, where the fungal pulses guide their decisions.
factions.ideology: They worship the fungal growths as a sentient force, believing it will eventually cleanse the world of the unworthy. Their goal is to spread the 'gospel' of the spores and convert or eliminate non-believers.
factions.territory: The underground maintenance tunnels and adjacent subway stations, where fungal growths are most dense.
perks: Immune to fungal infections
Can predict zombie movements via fungal pulses
Blend in with fungal environments
weaknesses: Vulnerable to fire and anti-fungal agents
Limited visibility in non-fungal areas

factions.name: The Rust Reavers
factions.description: A ruthless band of scavengers who prey on survivors and settlements, stripping anything of value from their victims. They operate in small, mobile groups to avoid detection and specialize in ambush tactics. Known for leaving behind only rusted scraps and bloodstains where they strike.
factions.ideology: Survival of the fittest through absolute domination. They believe the strong should take what they need from the weak, and view the apocalypse as an opportunity to carve out their own brutal kingdom.
factions.territory: Nomadic, but frequently haunt abandoned industrial zones, rail yards, and subway tunnels where they can ambush travelers and hide their loot.
perks: Master ambushers - excel at surprise attacks
Mechanical savants - can jury-rig nearly anything into a weapon or trap
Fear tactics - use gruesome displays to intimidate foes
weaknesses: Poor discipline - prone to infighting over spoils
No permanent base - vulnerable when caught in the open
